question: The graph shows the temperature variation over time. At approximately what time is the temperature at its highest point shown in the graph? What is the approximate temperature at time t=8.0?
explanation1: Observe the rightmost point on the graph. The x-coordinate of this point represents the time at which the temperature is highest. This occurs at approximately t=22.4.
explanation2: Locate t=8.0 on the x-axis. Move vertically up to the graph line and then horizontally to the y-axis to read the corresponding temperature. This value is approximately 10401.
